The Lenovo ThinkPad X13 Gen 3 laptop was released in 2022. It is available with an Intel or AMD Ryzen CPU. Some models include a fingerprint reader, a Smartcard reader, and a WWAN card.

To figure out which model you are using, run dmidecode -t system as root: the Product Name field starts with 21BN or 21BQ on Intel models and with 21CM or 21CN on AMD models.

sections.title: Accessibility
sections.content:
The BIOS offers two modes of operation, GUI and Simple Text.

The GUI can be navigated to some degree via the keyboard. Use the arrow keys to move the selection and Space to activate.

Switching to Simple Text can be accomplished by:

- Pressing Left to select the sidebar, then Down to select Config, then Space to activate it
- Holding Down for two seconds to select the drop-down menu at the very bottom
- Pressing Left to change it from Graphical to Simple Text
- Pressing F10, then Enter to save and exit

sections.title: Firmware
sections.content:
Firmware can be updated using fwupd. The UEFI BIOS can also be updated manually: download the ISO from Lenovo's support page for Intel or AMD models and use geteltoritoAUR to flash the BIOS from Linux. To check the BIOS version, run

```
$ cat /sys/class/dmi/id/bios_version
```

sections.title: Sound
sections.content: This laptop requires Sound Open Firmware in order for the sound card to work.
